Patient Particulars: Name: Georgia; Sex: Female; Family members: Parents, sister and a dog
Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
Presenting Symptom: Anxiety
Chief Complaint:
1) Anxiety leaving for work
2) fear of leaving parents and dog at home
3) Unable to go on trips
4) Feels guilty
History: Family History: Father has a history of heart attack.
Current Mental Status Examination: General appearance & behavior: Anxious; Speech: Normal; Mood & Affect: , Thought: disorganized; Cognitive functions: disturbed; Judgement and Insight: judgement is poor and Insight is  Intact
Psychotherapy Technique: Reflective listening, Cognitive Restructuring, Journaling, Thought challenging.
Issues discussed in Current Session:
There are few themes which are discussed in the session:
1. Fear and Anxiety: Patient has anxiety when she leaves home, be it for work or for short trips. She feels concerned about the well-being of her aging parents, and pets. She feels afraid of thinking potential negative events occurring while she is away, like her pet getting sick or her house being damaged.
2. Guilt and Responsibility: She always felt nervous to leave home since the time of her late teenage year as she feels guilty leaving their loved ones and pets behind and has a strong sense of responsibility for their well-being and fearing the consequences of not being there if something goes wrong.
3. Willingness to change: Patient is trying to engage in some adaptive responses, such as verbal reassurances to themselves and their pets, and making practical preparations before leaving like putting camera in the house. 
4. Techniques: Therapist used CBT model where he tried to formalize and expanded upon her adaptive responses by consciously challenging automatic negative thoughts with deliberate, positive self-talk. She was encouraged to develop and practice these adaptive responses to reduce anxiety.
5. Action Plan: Patient is advised to rate her anxiety levels before and after applying adaptive responses to assess their effectiveness over time which will help her to track her progress and determine the effectiveness of the intervention.
Action Plan: Patient is advised to measure her anxiety levels before and after applying adaptive responses to see the effects in her behavior which will help her track progress and determine the effectiveness of the intervention.
